    vig3_math

    vig3_math.Rmd

    Introduction

    Models for estimating historical age-specific rates

    Models for forecasting summary indicators

    Setting

    Let \(\gamma_{at}\) be a demographic rate for age group \(a\) during period \(t\). The rate could, for instance, be the first marriage rate, the remarriage rate, or the divorce rate. The rate might refer to the whole population, or to a specific sub-population, such as females in rural areas in a particular province. Each of these sub-populations is, at this stage in the modelling process, modelled independently. We have draws \(\gamma_{at}^{(s)}\), \(s = 1, \cdots S\), from the posterior distribution for \(\gamma_{at}\) for the years \(t = 1, \cdots, T\).

    Let \(\Gamma_t = \sum_{a=1}^A \gamma_{at}\) be a summary indicator for the rates, which we refer to as a “total” rate. Our aim is to draw from the distribution \[\begin{equation} p(\Gamma_{T+1}, \dots, \Gamma_{T+H} \mid \Gamma_{1}, \dots, \Gamma_{T}) \end{equation}\]

    We do this by drawing from \[\begin{equation} p(\Gamma_{T+1}^{(s)}, \dots, \Gamma_{T+H}^{(s)} \mid \Gamma_{1}^{(s)}, \dots, \Gamma_{T}^{(s)}) \end{equation}\] independently for each posterior draw \(s\).

    Model 1: Damped linear trend

    \[\begin{align} \Gamma_t^{(s)} & \sim \text{N}(\Gamma_{t-1}^{(s)} + \delta_{t-1}^{(s)}, \tau_{\Gamma}^{(s)2}) \\ \delta_t^{(s)} & \sim \text{N}(\phi^{(s)} \delta_{t-1}^{(s)}, \tau_{\delta}^{(s)2}) \\ \phi^{(s)} & = a_0 + (a_1 - a_0) \phi_0^{(s)} \\ \phi_0^{(s)} & \sim \text{Beta}(2, 2) \\ \tau_{\Gamma}^{(s)} & \sim \text{N}^+(0, A_{\Gamma}^2) \\ \tau_{\delta}^{(s)} & \sim \text{N}^+(0, A_{\delta}^2) \\ \end{align}\] By default, \(a_0 = 0.8\), \(a_1 = 0.98\), \(A_{\Gamma} = ??\), and \(A_{\delta} = ??\). (We will need to experiment with values.)
